definition[0]: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong
example[0]: She didn’t see the figure lurking behind the bushes.
definition[1]: if something such as danger, a feeling etc lurks somewhere, it exists, but you may not see it or know about it
example[1]: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
definition[2]: if you lurk in a chat room on the Internet, you read what other people are writing to each other, but you do not write any messages yourself
example[2]: I think it’s sort of creepy how people lurk in chat rooms.
